{{location infobox | name=White Towers | image=Ted Nasmith - The End of the Age.jpg | caption="The End of the Age" by [[Ted Nasmith]] | pronun= | othernames= | location=Western [[Eriador]], in the [[Tower Hills]] | type=Towers | description=Three great white towers where one of the [[Palantíri]] was posted | regions= | towns=[[Undertowers]]{{App|Later}} | inhabitants=[[Elves of Lindon]] | created=After {{SA|3320}}The towers were said to have been built by [[Gil-galad]] for his friend [[Elendil]]. The tallest of these, [[Elostirion]], was built to hold one of the [[palantíri]] of the [[North-kingdom]]. They must therefore have been raised after Elendil and his sons had settled in [[Middle-earth]], and after the division of the Seeing-stones had been agreed upon, so S.A. 3320 is the earliest possible date. | destroyed= | events= | gallery=the White Towers }} The '''White Towers''' were three tall towers located in the [[Tower Hills|Emyn Beraid]] west of [[the Shire]]. The westernmost tower, called [[Elostirion]],{{UT|Palantiri}}, note 2 had a ''[[Elostirion-stone|palantír]]'' which looked ever westward towards [[Valinor]].{{UT|Palantiri}}, note 16 The [[Shire-hobbits]] could see them shining far off in the moonlight; they said that from the top of Elostirion one could view the [[Belegaer|Sea]].{{FR|Hobbits}} ==History== The White Towers were built on the [[Tower Hills|Emyn Beraid]] by [[Gil-galad]] as a gift to [[Elendil]],{{S|Rings}} perhaps after the founding of [[Arnor]] ({{SA|3320}}{{App|SA}}). They were sometimes the destination of pilgrimage by [[Wandering Companies]] of [[Elves]] who would gaze to [[Valinor]] through the ''palantír''. Such a band, led by [[Gildor|Gildor Inglorion]], met [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]], [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]], and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] in the [[Woody End]] of the Shire on [[24 September]] {{TA|3018}}.{{FR|I3}} With time, the [[Shire-hobbits]] grew estranged from the Elves and the concept of the Sea became a word of terror and death, and they avoided looking upon the towers on the west. In [[September]] {{TA|3021|n}}{{App|Later}} the [[Last Riding of the Keepers of the Rings]], including Frodo and Sam, passed the White Towers on their way to the [[Grey Havens]].{{RK|VI9}} ==Other versions of the legendarium== According to J.R.R. Tolkien's [[Unfinished index]] for ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' the towers on the Hills were reputed to have been built by the elves, but they were actually built by Elendil.{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Tower Hills'', p. 28 ==Portrayal in adaptations== [[File:War in Middle Earth - The White Towers.png|thumb|left|The White Towers in ''[[J.R.R.
